description.narrative: International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) is an impartial, neutral and independent humanitarian organization working globally to protect and assist the victims of armed conflict and other situations of violence. The project is an un-earmarked contribution to the ICRC made within the framework of the Strategy for the Cooperation between Denmark and the ICRC in 2019-2023. In 2019-2023 Denmark’s priorities for ICRC are: 1) protection, humanitarian assistance and compliance with International Humanitarian Law (IHL), 2) leveraging synergies between humanitarian and development efforts, 3) coherence in the areas of stabilisation and security, and 4) technological transformation and increased effectiveness. Monitoring of Danish priority areas is based on ICRC’s own reporting on its strategy for 2019-2022.

title.narrative: 4. Working with others to enhance impact

Extent to which ICRC collaborates with relevant partners to facilitate access of affected populations to tools and services that build on and enhance their self-reliance, including access to education and livelihoods.
3. Building relevant and sustainable humanitarian impact with affected people

Extent to which ICRC response builds on existing capacities, reduce the vulnerability of affected people and enable them to better withstand future shocks.
Extent to which ICRC supports communities to adapt and transform their capacities and resources to better manage future stresses caused by combined effects of conflict and climate change.

Extent to which ICRC’s digital accessibility and response to affected populations has been enhanced.
Extent to which disaggregated data about affected populations is available and utilised to provide a more relevant humanitarian response, especially for youth, women and girls.
5. Contributing to coherence in the areas of stabilisation and security

Extent to which ICRC’s influencing work has contributed to expected outcomes and contributes to stabilisation.
Extent to which the behaviour of parties to conflict is influenced and the harmful impact on affected populations of violations of IHL and fundamental rights is decreased.
2. Influence behaviour to prevent violations of IHL and alleviate human suffering
Extent to which ICRC’s influencing work has contributed to expected outcomes.
1. Develop and scale up protection and assistance responses

Extent to which affected people’s needs have been met by a humanitarian response delivered directly or facilitated by ICRC.
Extent to which the specific vulnerabilities of women and girls are taken into account and their needs are met.
